instructions.asm: B.ATTR {trap, atomic, <aq, rl, aqrl>, far, DataLayout.{canon, normal}, SrcType, PadValue, DR}
B.HINT {BR.{likely, unlikely}, TEMP.{hot, warm, cool, none}, PRFSIZE}
bcnt srcL,  M, N, ->{t, u, Rd}
bic SrcL, M, N, ->{t, u, Rd}
bis SrcL, M, N, ->{t, u, Rd}

instructions.note: Alias of BSTART.CUBE Function=8. ACCCVT requires quantization args via B.ARG+B.IOR (scale/zero-point required in strict profile).
Generic CUBE selector form. Function=0/2/8 are emitted as BSTART.TMATMUL/BSTART.TMATMUL.ACC/BSTART.ACCCVT aliases.
Legacy compatibility TEPL spelling; canonical strict-v0.3 output uses BSTART.TEPL TileOp10, DataType.
TileOp10 selects PTO template ops (for example TADD TSUB TROWMAX). Unassigned TileOp10 values are reserved for future template extension.
Alias of BSTART.TMA Function=0. Requires B.ARG layout/pad and B.IOR stride/base plus B.IOT/B.IOTI tile binding.
Generic TMA selector form. Function=0/1/2 are emitted as BSTART.TLOAD/BSTART.TSTORE/BSTART.TMOV aliases; 3..31 are reserved in strict v0.3.
Alias of BSTART.CUBE Function=0. Requires B.DIM (LB0/LB1/LB2 as m,n,k) and tile bindings via B.IOT/B.IOTI.
Alias of BSTART.CUBE Function=2. Requires B.DIM (LB0/LB1/LB2 as m,n,k) and tile bindings via B.IOT/B.IOTI.
Alias of BSTART.TMA Function=2. TMOV is tile-state only (no GM memory access) and destination allocation is queue-push only.
Alias of BSTART.TMA Function=1. Requires B.ARG layout/pad and B.IOR stride/base plus B.IOT/B.IOTI tile binding.
TVEC-equivalent parallel SIMT header; requires B.TEXT body target in decoupled form.
TVEC-equivalent sequential SIMT header; requires B.TEXT body target in decoupled form.

tile_reg.description: LinxISA tile registers for accelerator-oriented blocks (TMA, CUBE, VPAR/VSEQ, MSEQ/MPAR). 32 architectural tiles with variable size (512B-4KB each). Organized as 4 hands (T, U, M, N) × 8 depth = 32 tiles.
notes: Strict v0.3 architectural tile register file: 32 tiles (T/U/M/N hands × depth 8).
Each tile has an architectural size tracked in the range [512B, 4KB].
Tile registers are addressed by hand+index (for example T#0, U#3, M#2, N#5).
Tile registers are used by tile/vector blocks such as BSTART.TMA, BSTART.CUBE, BSTART.VPAR/VSEQ and bridged MSEQ/MPAR flows.
Implementations may provision more physical tiles than architectural (renaming support).
Architectural state is intentionally minimal here: this repo treats the compiled catalog as the primary machine-readable source.
v0.3 staged profile keeps v0.2 architectural baseline and only promotes reconciled AI-extension semantics.
Deferred raw items (for example unresolved MAMULBMX group=2 behavior) are intentionally omitted from canonical state.

group_execution_mode.MPAR: groups/lanes may execute in parallel but must preserve architectural ordering guarantees
group_execution_mode.MSEQ: groups/lanes retire in lexicographic LC order

simt_group_model.scalar_uniform_lane: each group has one scalar-uniform lane context; scalar body instructions execute once per group replay

vector_body_mixed_execution.replay: body executes once per LC tuple in linear program order

vector_instruction_operand_contract.exception: zero literal allowed where encoding permits
vector_instruction_operand_contract.scalar_inputs: must be imported via B.IOR and consumed as ri*

compiler_staged_lowering.identity_requirement: staged reduction lowering requires identity initializer for the selected reduction operation
compiler_staged_lowering.liveout_bridge: for strict bring-up, compiler may materialize reduction live-out through `V.RD*` followed by a bridged scratch store (`V.SW.BRG` via ri* binding)

vector_reduction_contract.mp_ar_compiler_rule: compiler emits MPAR reduction only when dependence-safe (associative/commutative or explicit programmer parallel hint)
vector_reduction_contract.scope: reduce lane values to a scalar destination

semantics: Orders memory operations of classes selected by pred_imm before operations selected by succ_imm in program order for the current LXCPU.
Under TSO, FENCE.D is required to order with device/MMIO domains and to create stronger cross-domain ordering points.
Ensures instruction fetch observes prior stores from the current LXCPU to memory that may be executed as code.
Defines the architectural boundary for self-modifying code and code generation.

channel_contract.mtc: Tile memory channel (TLOAD/TSTORE/TPREFETCH and bridged MSEQ/MPAR flows)
channel_contract.rule: BCC and MTC operations participate in one TSO architectural ordering domain for a single LXCPU.

simt_lane_policy.rule: Inactive-lane behavior is explicit and deterministic; implementations must not mix merge/zero semantics within one architectural mode.

semantics: TLOAD/TSTORE are architectural memory operations in the same TSO domain as scalar load/store.
TLOAD/TSTORE participate in aq/rl/fence ordering and must not violate store->store ordering.
A single TLOAD/TSTORE may decompose into multiple internal beats and is architecturally non-atomic to external observers.
Page faults during TLOAD/TSTORE are precise and restartable by software.

tso_axioms: Program-order store->store ordering is preserved for all addresses.
A younger load may read from memory before an older unrelated store becomes globally visible (store buffer behavior).
Store->load reordering is only visible as allowed by TSO; fence/aq/rl tighten ordering.
No operation may observe a younger store from the same LXCPU before an older store.

notes: Strict v0.3 current profile uses TSO as the architectural memory model.
The TSO contract applies to both scalar (BCC) and tile-memory (MTC/TMA) channels.
A single LXCPU must not reorder committed stores (including TSTORE beats) ahead of older stores.

debug_ssr.description: v0.2 bring-up debug SSRs (breakpoints/watchpoints with optional linking).

ebarg_group.description: EBARG is the authoritative trap/context snapshot for v0.2. EBARG words are ACR-scoped manager-family SSRs (0xnf40+).

entries.description: Packed control word: BlockType, GroupID, TYPE/TAKEN/TRAP, order attributes.
entries.name: EBARG0_ACRn

entries.description: Body resume PC (TPC). Valid when ECSTATE.BI=1.
entries.name: EBARG_TPC_ACRn

entries.description: Local return address (LRA) for split/decoupled blocks.
entries.name: EBARG_LRA_ACRn

entries.description: Pointer to extended-context buffer for ESAVE/ERCOV.
entries.name: EBARG_EXTCTX_PTR_ACRn

notes: v0.3 staged profile system registers (SSR) and trap envelope definitions.
v0.3 staged profile preserves the v0.2 ACR/EBARG/TRAPNO baseline while integrating reconciled AI-extension semantics.
This file is the canonical source for SSR IDs, EBARG layout, and TRAPNO encoding used by the ISA manual, QEMU, Linux, and LLVM.

base.description: Cycle counter (bring-up may model as instruction count).
base.name: CYCLE

base.description: Common state (privilege + execution state). Includes active ACR and interrupt mask.
base.name: CSTATE

manager_acr_family.description: Manager-ACR (privileged) SSR family. Full SSR_ID is 16-bit where n is the manager ACR ID and low 12 bits select the index.

entries.description: Exception state. Mirrors key CSTATE fields. Includes BI and ACR target for ACRE.
entries.name: ECSTATE_ACRn

entries.description: CPU MMU memory attribute indirection register (ACR1).
entries.name: MAIR_ACR1

bringup_trapnums.description: Target Exec State Check (e.g. illegal ACRE target).
bringup_trapnums.name: EXEC_STATE_CHECK

bringup_trapnums.description: Illegal instruction / illegal SSR / illegal encoding.
bringup_trapnums.name: ILLEGAL_INST

notes: TRAPNO is shared for faults, traps, and interrupts.
E=1 indicates asynchronous interrupt; E=0 indicates synchronous fault/trap.
